name: Center for Autism and Related Disorders: Arlington
description:
The Center for Autism and Related Disorders provides ABA therapy programs for the treatment of autism and related disorders. The following text is from the CARD website: "Following the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis, we developed a treatment approach for children with autism, up to age seven, that focuses on minimizing challenging behaviors and maximizing skill acquisition. Once new behaviors are mastered, we focus on generalization with the goal of transitioning each child into the mainstream educational system. If necessary, we also provide school shadowing services so children have the support they need in the classroom."
"CARD advertises itself to teach self-help and safety skills, build language and communication, as well as an array of advanced skills such as theory of mind, social skills, and executive functioning. With the input of parents and the child’s caregivers, we set challenging goals for our team and the child and track progress on each skill domain carefully."
organization: Center for Autism and Related Disorders

name: CARD Academy
description: Licensed as a Private Special Education Day School by the Virginia Department of Education, the CARD Academy is committed to providing children with top-tier instruction, led by the most experienced and qualified teachers in a safe, fun, and nurturing environment.
organization: Center for Autism and Related Disorders

name: Visual Supports Toolkit
description: A handout explaining the use of Picture Exchange Communication systems (PECS), visual schedules, and first-then boards as methods for promotion independent and functional communication in individuals with autism. These tools can also be helped promote other activities of independence, such as tolerating transitions and delayed access to preferred items or activities. This resource was published by Autism Speaks in collaboration with the Vanderbilt Kennedy Center.
organization: Autism Speaks TM and Vanderbilt Kennedy Center

name: Visual Strategies for Improving Communication (Revised and Updated)
description: Book about use of visual strategies
organization: QuirkRoberts Publishing

name: Summer Camp - Questions to ask
description: This resource details questions parents of children with special needs may want to include when inquiring about summer camp opportunities for their child(ren)
organization: Unknown source

name: Autism Speaks (TM) Family Services' Dental Guide
description: This handout presents families with a guide on promoting oral health in your child with autism. It includes tips on promoting teeth brushing, on how to prepare for dental visits, and how to work dentists to ensure that a dental visit is as successful as possible.
organization: Autism Speaks TM

name: Exploring Feeding Behavior in Autism
description: This parent guide presents recommendations for managing picky eating and related challenging behavior surrounding eating in individuals with autism.
organization: Autism Speaks TM

name: Tips and Resources for Promoting Internet Safety
description: This handout presents parents and/or caregivers with tips and resources on how to promote safe internet in their child or adult.
organization: Source unknown

name: Autism: Should My Child Take Medicine for Challenging Behavior
description: This toolkit, published by Autism Speaks and the Autism Intervention Research Network on Physical Health (AIR-P), provides caregivers with a decision aid when considering psychotropic medications as treatment options to manage their child's challenging behavior, answers to frequently asked questions about medication use, information about common medication side effects, personal stories from families, and a review of alternative options for caregivers to consider.
organization: Autism Speaks TM

name: Antipsychotics and Autism Review Paper
description: This peer-reviewed research article (Posey et al., 2008) presents research evidence evaluating the use of antipsychotics in people with autism.
organization: The Journal of Clinical Investigation

name: Autism Spectrum Disorders Fact Sheet: Antipsychotics and Autism
description: This fact sheet published by www.autism-help.org presents an overview of the research on antipsychotic medication use in people with autism, overview of the history of its use, the terminology surrounding antipsychotics, information about atypical antipsychotics, the physiological drug actions, side effects, efficacy of antipsychotics for mental health conditions, and a comparison of typical versus atypical antipsychotics.
organization: Autism-Help.Org

name: Risperidone in Children with Autism
description: This peer-reviewed research article (RUPP, 2002) presents research evidence for the use of risperidone for the management of irritability in individuals with autism.
image: Is it possible to add a non-copyrighted image of medication here, for example: https://www.google.com/search?q=medication&rlz=1C1GCEU_enUS821US821&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiC87vDsPDfAhVlplkKHcAYACgQ_AUIDigB&biw=1536&bih=750#imgrc=HEkHOdXgqgtlmM:
organization: The New England Journal of Medicine

name: Ziprasidone in Autism
description: This peer-reviewed research article (Dominick et al., 2015) This is a peer-reviewed research article presenting research evidence for the use of an antipsychotic medication, ziprasidone, for the management of irritability in individuals with autism.
